jtxt.emulator

Class BitmapFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.BitmapFont

  • public class BitmapFont
extends java.lang.Object
    A font which has been rasterized and saved in an appropriate image format. This kind of font does not need to be rasterized but, rather, only needs to serve a matching glyph from the image when requested to do so.
    See Also:
    getCharacterAsImage(Glyph)

    • Field Detail

      • minCodePoint

        public final int minCodePoint
        The ASCII code for the first character in the bitmap font. This defines the starting point for the range of character values that this font supports.

      • maxCodePoint

        public final int maxCodePoint
        The ASCII code for the last character in the bitmap font. This defines the ending point for the range of character values that this font supports.

      • charWidth

        protected int charWidth

      • charHeight

        protected int charHeight

      • xOffset

        private int xOffset

      • yOffset

        private int yOffset

      • glyphs

        private java.awt.image.WritableRaster[] glyphs
        The raw glyph values within this font. (Each of these rasters must be processed before it can be appropriately rendered.)

      • inCM

        private java.awt.image.ColorModel inCM

      • outCM

        private java.awt.image.ColorModel outCM

      • colorMask

        private int colorMask
        The color that will be filtered out of the bitmap. All pixels of this color will be turned transparent.
